member.name: T:Inv.LogFolder
member.summary: Represents a folder containing multiple log file series.

remarks.para: After creating a object, create one or more objects using and then call on the object(s) to receive objects which can be used to write to disk.
Unlike Inv.LogFile, actual writes to the log file are unmanaged; directly exposes a , so for logs that comprise mostly string records, Inv.LogFile will probably be more useful.

example.para: This example will write a single log entry to the 'series1' log series in C:\Temp. Each time the code is run, a new log file will be generated with an incrementing filename; files older than 30 days (by default) will be automatically deleted.

member.param: The interface to an implementation of the log directory.

member.summary: Add a new series of log files with the specified extension and name to the .
member.param: The name to give the new .
The title to give the new .
The extension of the log files in the new .
member.returns: The new object.

member.summary: Open the log folder, creating it if necessary.

member.summary: Close all the associated with this .

member.name: M:Inv.LogFolder.Rollover
member.summary: Request to break the log file to the new day, instead of waiting for the first log line of the new day to be written.

member.name: T:Inv.LogSeries
member.summary: Represents a series of log files.

remarks.para: objects are not directly instantiated. Instead, use LogFolder.AddSeries(String) to obtain a new object.
manages creating and deleting individual log files automatically; actual log output is done via a obtained by calling .
By default, log files managed by a are deleted after 30 days. To modify this, set an appropriate value for .

member.name: T:Inv.PipeStream
member.summary: Represents a Unix-style pipe of data between a reader and a writer thread.

remarks.para: can be used to pipe data between threads. After creating the with the desired maximum buffer size, the reader thread should attempt to data from the ; this call will block until data is available.
The writer thread can data into the at any point; as enough data becomes available for the reader thread to read, will return.

member.name: M:Inv.PipeStream.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new with the specified buffer size.
member.param: The maximum size of the buffer to use for this .

member.name: P:Inv.PipeStream.WriteSize
member.summary: The total number of bytes written to this .

member.name: P:Inv.PipeStream.CanRead
member.summary: True; supports reading.

member.name: P:Inv.PipeStream.CanSeek
member.summary: False; does not support seeking.

member.name: P:Inv.PipeStream.CanWrite
member.summary: True; supports writing.

member.name: P:Inv.PipeStream.Length
member.summary: Get the length in bytes of the stream.

member.name: P:Inv.PipeStream.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the position within the current stream. Always 0 for , cannot be set.

member.name: M:Inv.PipeStream.Flush
member.summary: Flush the , signaling any blocked readers that there is available data.

member.name: M:Inv.PipeStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Write data to the .
member.remarks: will block if the buffer fills up until a reader successfully reads some bytes from the .
member.param: The buffer containing the data to write.
The first byte within the buffer to write.
The number of bytes to write to the .

member.name: M:Inv.PipeStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Attempt to read data from the .
member.remarks: will block until the buffer has been flushed, and until either the buffer is full or there are at least bytes available to read.
member.param: The buffer to store read data into.
The offset into the buffer to start storing read data to.
The number of bytes to read.
member.returns: The number of bytes successfully read.

member.name: M:Inv.PipeStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Set the position within the current stream. Not implemented by .
member.exception: Always thrown; does not support seeking.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the parameter.
A value of type indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current stream.

member.name: M:Inv.PipeStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Set the length of the current stream. Not implemented by .
member.param: The desired length of the current stream in bytes.
